txt.en: 'The only Orc that belongs in the Mark is a dead one!'
'I might think you would seek that title for yourself, snake.'
'You care nothing for the people, Athelward!'
'Aye! The filth must pay for what they have done.'
'Enough of this! You lot are naught but clucking hens. Blood darkens the grass while you bicker!'
'My thoughts are with my kin, my kith, my folk... all slaughtered in Thornhope.'
'My sword, if you wish it, goes to whomever will bid me bloody it most.'
'As Hytbold is your town, upon your permission I will open the Witan, and we shall decide if we will stand up for our people and defend the Eastemnet.'
'It is time to stand and defend all you have built here.'
The Witan has begun
The Witan has been interrupted. Something is happening outside
'All who wish to follow the Council of the Eastemnet, speak!'
'And who would hold with the King and his bidding?'
'And Béortnoth? Where lie your thoughts?'
'As I feared, we are still much at odds. Perhaps a fresh mind is needed.'
'[placeholder], all here have learned to trust you.'
'What say you? Should we break faith with the King, or....'
The Lords of the Eastemnet are holding a Witan to decide the fate of their lands.
'Then the time for words is over. Come, my friends! Draw your swords!'
'Indeed. Many are the terrors unleashed upon us.'
'But we cannot forsake Théoden King. Such would be turning our backs upon the Mark itself.'
'The King is overmastered. My own son has seen it. That wretch Wormtongue is to blame.'
'Our best hope is to put the one who has weakened him to the blade.'
'If I march anywhere, it shall be to Edoras for Gríma's head!'
'As long as Wormtongue has Théoden's ear, all is ruined. Follow me to Edoras!'
'What is it, man? Why do you interrupt the Witan? Speak!'
Talk to Harding to signal the beginning of the Witan
Attend and observe the Witan
'We must wait for Éomer. He will take our plea to the King.'
'Théoden will hearken to the counsel of his nephew, the Third Marshal of the Riddermark.'
'I cannot believe that. If Théoden has truly fallen, then so has all the Mark.'
'My father keeps faith with Théoden, as do I. Éomer will know what to do.'
The Witan is being held in Hytbold.
The Witan has begun and the Lords are discussing the future of the Eastemnet.
'My lord! Fear, fire, and foes! The West Gate burns!'
'I am with Lord Fastred. King or Council, what matter? There are Orc-necks to hew.'
'I will stand beside you on the battlefield, Béortnoth. Let our enemies weep!'
'The King has given his bidding. We must obey! We swore oaths of loyalty until death.'
'Be not hasty, young Fastred. We all wish to protect our lands. Every man here thirsts for Orc-blood.'
'Théoden's bidding is clear. Forsake him, and the kingdom will burn.'
'But say on, Lord Harding... you seek to make this Council, but who would lead it? You?'
'Would you name yourself King of the Eastemnet?'
'My lords, bide a moment, if you will. A Rider has come bringing news from Cliving.'
'As Reeve of the Wold and Aldor of the North-march, I, Harding, son of Harda, call this Witan.'
'Ride on Edoras itself? Is that your grand idea to support the King, Lord Ingbert?'
'Our lands are beset, our sons and daughters suffer and die, and our King does nothing.'
'Such talk alone is treason. Your head is not so far from the ground that you cannot lose it.'
'My duty is to my people. I ask we form a council to defend the Eastemnet.'
'Then let us stand together -- here, not in Edoras -- and take up arms.'
'We must choose a wiser path, my friends.'
'The King cannot be saved. Prince Théodred's death has unmanned him past return.'
'Thank you, Béortnoth. Calm yourselves, my friends. The kingdom will neither be saved, nor die this very night.'
'Our only choice is to defy the King.'
'Whatever path we choose, we must be sure in our deeds and we must act together.'
'Lord Athelward, you speak the truth, as ever.'
'Whose death? How many more of my folk must bleed before Théoden upholds his own duty?'
'I am ready to stay as long as I must, until this Witan is all of one mind.'
'It does no good to slay every Orc this side of the Entwash if doing so tears us asunder.'
'I will not stand idle while my people suffer.'
'Aye.'
'So, then. While we wait, let us have a tally to see where things stand.'
'Words, words. This talk wastes our time.'
The Witan: Lords of the Eastemnet
'What matter who leads, so long as we slay our foes?'
'Trust Éomer? More fool, you. If the King has been swayed, then surely he has too.'
'The only way to save the Mark is to ride out at once. Ride and destroy our enemies!'
